ca.uwo.csd.cs2212.team06

Class AwardData

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uwo.csd.cs2212.team06.AwardData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AwardData
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is used to check the squirrel badge(called Nutty), the time specific badges(called Early Bird and Night Owl), the triathalon badge(called Triple Threat), and the heartrate badge (called Healthy Heart) badge. These badges require this class because of how the user fulfills their requirments.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Team06
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AwardData

        public AwardData()
        Constructor for the AwardData. Using data from the awardData.dat file, it determines whether any badges have been earned.

    • Method Detail

      • timeAwards

        private int[] timeAwards()
        calculates steps takes between midnight and 2am and 4am and 6am for use with night owl and early bird badges
        Parameters:
        timeAwards - int[]

      • timeAwards

        public int[] timeAwards(java.lang.String date)
        Calculates the Night Owl and Early Bird badges. Does so by pulling the past days data and then checking whether the user has exercised during the night or during the morning.
        Parameters:
        date - String of the date
        Returns:
        steps an int array where the first index stores the night and the second index stores the morning

      • heartrateDays

        private int heartrateDays()
        Calculates if heart rate was in cardio range for last 7 days
        Returns:
        max an int representing number of days heart rate was in cardio range

      • squirrelAward

        public boolean squirrelAward(RequestData req)

      • triathalete

        public int[] triathalete(RequestData req)
        Checks if client has ran, swam, and biked for the current date. If so, they have earned the Triple Threat badge.
        Parameters:
        req - the RequestData object that stores the data necessary to determine whether the badge has been earned
        Returns:
        data[] int[] of the minutes the user has proven in each of the three given activities

      • loadAwardData

        public static AwardData loadAwardData()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads from the awardDat.dat file to determine which the badges that the user has earned.
        Returns:
        data a data file of all the badges that have been earned by the user
        Throws:
        exception - thrown if the input cannot be read
        java.lang.Exception

      • storeAwardData

        public static void storeAwardData(AwardData data)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Stores the badges that have earned to a .dat file called awardData.dat.
        Parameters:
        data - AwardData object to be read from
        Throws:
        exception - thrown if the output cannot be written to
        java.lang.Exception

        public int getNightSteps()
        Returns an int value of the number of steps the user has taken at night. Used by timeAward() to determine whether the Night Owl badge has been acheived.
        Returns:
        nightSteps int value of the number of steps that have been taken at night

      • getEarlySteps

        public int getEarlySteps()
        Returns an int value of the number of steps the user has taken during the morning. Used by timeAward() to determine whether the Early Bird badge has been acheived.
        Returns:
        earlySteps int value of the number of steps that have been taken during the morning

      • getRunMinutes

        public int getRunMinutes()

        Returns:
        runMinutes int value of the number of minutes the user has run

      • getSwimMinutes

        public int getSwimMinutes()

        Returns:

      • getBikeMinutes

        public int getBikeMinutes()

        Returns:

      • getDaysAboveInARow

        public int getDaysAboveInARow()
        Returns an int value of the number of days the user has had their heart rate above a certain rate. Used by heartrateDays() to determine whether the user has earned the Healthy Heart badge.
        Returns:
        daysAboveInARow int value of the number of how many days the user has had their heart rate above a predetermined perimeter

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Used for the test cases. Uses a pregenerated awardData.dat file that does not require an API request.
        Throws:
        thrown - if the awardData.dat file cannot be read
        java.lang.Exception
